title: It's been the wrong year to sell in May and go away. The bull market seems ‘unstoppable,' experts say
text:
U.S. economy grew slightly faster 6.6% pace in second quarter, new GDP figures show

The U.S. grew a bit faster in the spring than previously estimated, but not enough to change the underlying growth trend in an economy that's recovered quite rapidly from the pandemic. GDP was raised to a 6.6% annual rate of growth from 6.5%. See full story.

This could be Apple's next $20 billion business

Apple Inc. could turn advertising into its next $20 billion business as the company ramps up its offerings and clamps down on ad targeting by third parties. See full story.

My father died last year without a will. My brother and I finally inherited his house. Will we need to pay taxes when we sell it?

'What is the best way to sell the house to avoid capital gains or taxes? Is there a specific timeline that governs this?' See full story.

‘A mouthful of hot water with sugar': Why pumpkin spice latte and other Starbucks fall offerings may not measure up to the hype

New this year on the Starbucks fall menu: the Apple Crisp Macchiato See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

If you're not leasing your vehicle, and your loan is paid off, is collision insurance worth it? Deciding whether to hang on to the coverage can be tricky. See full story.
